channel.title: What are your PC specs?
channel.description:
I think there was a topic about this in the past, but it's pretty old so I figured I'd start a new one.
Today I rebuilt my computer because I bought a new case and cpu/mobo.
I upgraded from a AMD 6100 and pretty shitty mobo to the Intel 4790k.
Current build: https://pcpartpicker.com/user/Davidi2/saved/6ZQ9TW
My next step is to get new ram (gunna replace my 2x4 with just 2x8 probably) and a new cpu cooler (currently using stock cooler) so that I can overclock.
What is your build?

stop going for stupid leds you 10 year old

and stfu i can do what i want, my current blue led fan looks badass with my case[/quote]DAVID I WILL EAT YOU LIKE A BANANA

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:56, topic:551992”]The CPU looks pretty overpriced and badly benchmarked, how is it working for you?
[/quote]

I bought it about a year after it came out. I plan on upgrading to either the 4770K or 4790K and getting a new mobo. Also, the USB headers on the mobo are starting to intermittently stop working. It also for some reason, if I tell the computer to sleep manually (not letting the timer do it), it doesn’t wake up.

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:61, topic:551992”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=670909.msg4487853#msg4487853 date=1435420648]My only concern is that you could have gotten more bang for buck if you had planned better, that is why I’m upset. Otherwise it’s decent to be honest.

edit yupay4windows rip
[/quote]
Because I wanted a genuine copy for the first time since XP.
And ya’know… it comes with an upgrade to 10 if I ever decide to upgrade.[/quote]I suppose that is a fair point. HAPPY GAYMING!!

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:59, topic:551992”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=670909.msg4487844#msg4487844 date=1435407368]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670909.msg4487834#msg4487834 date=1435398663]

The CPU looks pretty overpriced and badly benchmarked, how is it working for you?

Holy shit that scared me…
I just bought my first build today…
Know this:
It was totally unexpected, I got to micro center and was told I can build a new PC. I’m not exactly experienced in building them (clearly), and had 0 time to research anything…

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/YFCjkL
I believe that’s everything. There may have been some substitutions on parts (Optical drive for one), but I made sure the price was similar and the part was close to the exact same.

Considering buying the bundle on https://www.humblebundle.com/ because I actually have a pc that can play it now lol.
[/quote]shit gpu get a good one -.-

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670909.msg4487828#msg4487828 date=1435392863]
The CPU looks pretty overpriced and badly benchmarked, how is it working for you?

[/quote]buying a part new from 5+ years ago at suggested retail price is obviously going to look expensive in the future, its a very old cpu

[quote author=Zymus link=topic=670909.msg4487810#msg4487810 date=1435374547]

l need to upgrade the mobo and cpu soon. Maybe another SSD, I don’t know yet.


[/quote]is this a joke

Which part?
[/quote]cpu bottelneckz

I was on a budget. But between the mobo and the power supply I’ll be able to upgrade later on.[/quote]My only concern is that you could have gotten more bang for buck if you had planned better, that is why I’m upset. Otherwise it’s decent to be honest.

edit yupay4windows rip

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:50, topic:551992”]My system is kind of old/outdated at the moment but it still gets the job done

cpu - 8350 vishera
Motherboard - some sort of giabyte that isn’t worth a toot lol
memory - corsair dom 16gb 1866
power supply 800w silver (thermaltake i think?)
samsung ssd
wd 2tb hard drive(was a nice sale on BestBuy one day had to get it)
video card - I have two different cards and I only use the better card if I plan to play something highly intensive as my computer can get quite hot and i would rather not damage it more than needed

  1. 2 x 7850 radeon crossfire
  2. gt780

Monitors:

2 x 1920x1080 LG 23’ monitors[/quote]Your build seems nice, if you have $200 to spare you should care package it.

(if you happen to take my advice make sure the parts are compatible pls ty)

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower

@Loveandpower wrote:

My system is kind of old/outdated at the moment but it still gets the job done

cpu - 8350 vishera

memory - corsair dom 16gb 1866
power supply 800w silver (thermaltake i think?)
samsung ssd
wd 2tb hard drive(was a nice sale on BestBuy one day had to get it)
video card - I have two different cards and I only use the better card if I plan to play something highly intensive as my computer can get quite hot and i would rather not damage it more than needed

  1. 2 x 7850 radeon crossfire
  2. gt780

Monitors:

2 x 1920x1080 LG 23’ monitors

@davidi2 wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“rmark45matsu, post:46, topic:551992”]Just putting this out there for anyone who is interested.

Evga has something called B stock, which basically means: “B-Stock Products are units which may have small scratches, small dents, or noticeable use which are Factory Recertified to meet or exceed the performance of a new product of the same model. These products do not come with any accessories and include a 1 year limited warranty.”

EVGA

Products - B-Stock

Products - B-Stock

They basically have large discounts, a 970 is $239 here. - http://prntscr.com/7jwsl3[/quote]

That sounds sketchy , i wouldn’t gamble

It’s just like used/refurbished parts from amazon

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

"They basically have large discounts"
No, they’re selling you used parts that may or may not shit out on you.
Hence the “limited warrenty”. Because they won’t cover everything that happens to a used product, vs a product that’s never been opened.

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

Just putting this out there for anyone who is interested.

Evga has something called B stock, which basically means: “B-Stock Products are units which may have small scratches, small dents, or noticeable use which are Factory Recertified to meet or exceed the performance of a new product of the same model. These products do not come with any accessories and include a 1 year limited warranty.”

EVGA

Products - B-Stock

Products - B-Stock

They basically have large discounts, a 970 is $239 here. - http://prntscr.com/7jwsl3

Read full topic

item.title: What are your PC specs?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:42, topic:551992”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=670909.msg4487027#msg4487027 date=1434734293]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670909.msg4487021#msg4487021 date=1434731947]

Check this out , http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/amd-radeon-r9-390x-r9-380-r7-370,4178.html
[/quote]as expected, still worse than the 970

Why is that? I think they are actually pretty good , and i wish i got the 380 4gb instead of the 960 i already got but it’s too late.
[/quote]I mean looking at the benchmarks it looks pretty even with the 970, but its miles behind the 980, i guess it’ll come down to the price[/quote]

Price is $270 for MSI’s version , Close to the 970 performance and cheaper. I think it’s a great deal

Read full topic
